[http://www.kdu.ac.lk/ www.kdu.ac.lk] |footnotes= }} 'General Sir John
Kotelawala Defence University' (KDU) located at Kandawala, Ratmalana, Colombo,
is a joint services academy where cadets of the three wings Sri Lanka Army, Sri
Lanka Navy and Sri Lanka Air Force are trained before they go for their pre-
commission training to their academies. Established in 1980 as the 'General Sir
John Kotelawala Defence Academy', named after General Sir John Kotelawala, 3rd
Prime Minister of Ceylon; it was renamed as a university by an amendment bill
passed in Parliament on October 11, 2007.
